pr_title: refactor(client): add ColumnType, KsqlObject, KsqlArray, BatchedQueryResult

timeline.bodyText: I would also add a method to convert to a JSON string (just delegate to the underlying method), this would be super useful.
timeline.author: purplefox

replies.bodyText: Done. I've added both toJsonString() and toString() (with the same implementation) in order to be explicit but I can remove toJsonString() if you think it's unncessary.
replies.author: vcrfxia

timeline.bodyText: This object is only intended to be used a return value from the API not as a general purpose JsonArray object so I'd keep the constructor hidden
timeline.author: purplefox

replies.author: vcrfxia

timeline.author: purplefox

replies.bodyText: The current names StreamQueryResponseHandler and ExecuteQueryResponseHandler parallel the client methods streamQuery() and executeQuery(), in contrast to the return types StreamedQueryResult and BatchedQueryResult. If the discrepancy is confusing we can rename to either StreamQueryResult/ExecuteQueryResult or StreamedQueryResponseHandler/BatchedQueryResponseHandler but I don't think we should have a mix with StreamedQueryResponseHandler and ExecuteQueryResponseHandler. Do you have a preference?
replies.author: vcrfxia

timeline.author: purplefox

replies.bodyText: You mean the ColumnType interface or the implementation class ColumnTypeImpl? The sort of string manipulation in this method feels odd in the interface. If we put it in the implementation, would it make more sense to instead update the constructor to perform the trimming, rather than having a static method for it? (Either's fine with me, just want to clarify what you had in mind.)
replies.author: vcrfxia
